titles: At the Council of State at White-Hall. The Parliament having lately intrusted this Council to take care that the good people of England, Scotland, and Ireland, be protected in their peaceable assemblies ...
author: England and Wales. Council of State.
publisher: Printed by Henry Hills, Printer to the Council of State,
notes: Title from caption and opening lines of text.
Signed and dated at end: Saturday November 12. 1653. John Thurloe, Secr.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Freedom of religion --  Great Britain --  Early works to 1800.
